cards.title: See how aid works
cards.description: Almost half of all Stanford undergraduates receive need-based financial aid. Families earning less than $150,000 with assets typical of that income level pay no tuition. Families earning less than $100,000 with assets typical of that income level pay no tuition or room and board.

cards.title: Types of financial aid
cards.description: Stanford provides financial aid in the form of scholarships, which do not need to be repaid. Federal and state grants, outside scholarships, and student employment are additional sources of funding. We do not expect you to take out student loans to cover your college costs.

cards.title: Testing long word like University or Opportunities
cards.description: The average need-based scholarship in the current freshman class is more than $62,000. Use the net price calculator tool to see what level of financial aid you can expect to receive if you attend.
